Imperial Decay (10-20)

An empire is a hard thing to hold together. The massive bureaucracy can become corrupt, and the sheer difficulty in sending messages across such a large expanse can lead to its own kind of entropy. Imperial Decay measures that entropy, and increases each time the title changes hands based on how large and centralized the empire has become.

Imperial Decay is §Rincreased§! by:
* The title changing hands (more if it is usurped)
* Crown authority is low
* Having a very large realm
* Losing crusades and holy wars
* Losing against major invasions
* Random events caused by a poor ruler or regent

Imperial Decay can be §Greduced§! by:
* Becoming coronated
* Crown authority is high
* The realm is overthrown by an internal revolt
* Holding a tournament/furusiyya
* Using the 'Lower Imperial Decay' decision
* Winning crusades and holy wars
* Winning major invasions and rebellions
* Enforcing imperial de jure claims
* Random events caused by a good ruler or regent

Claim the Imperial Throne
For too long has the Imperial seat been occupied by wastrels and corrupt idiots! It is time for a new dynasty to rise and restore the empire to greatness!
Imperial Coronation
Being officially coronated by a priest of your faith will legitimize your rule among your subjects, and also offers a chance to impress your allies.
Corrupt Councillor

There are some benefits to possessing a large imperial bureaucracy, and one of them is the ability to corrupt the corruptible. You can use the trappings of power to lure §Y[Root.GetBestName]§! into a sense of gratitude, even if that means increasing the decay of your empire as a whole. In urgent times, this might be all that stands between you and a revolt.
Lower Imperial Decay

Current §YImperial Decay§!: §R[Root.PrimaryTitle.imperial_decay.GetValue]§!\nPerhaps it is time to institute a series of reforms in the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. If the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] can enforce the reforms through sheer force of will and charisma, things will improve...but not all of [Root.GetHerHis] subjects will be happy about it.
Make Title Inheritable

Grant §Y[Root.GetBestName]§! the right to have [Root.GetHerHis] titles inherited by [Root.GetHerHis] heirs, with the Imperial Government no longer assigning ownership. Once assigned this right, the title will remain inherited until and unless usurped.
Prove Your Rule
The perception appears to be that you are not a strong ruler of the Byzantine Empire. Prove your vassals wrong, and then work towards restoring the Empire to the greatness it deserves!
Request Imperial Coronation

Although you already rule in the Byzantine Empire, an official coronation by the Ecumenical Patriarch will solidify your rule and allow you to exert greater influence over your vassals. Without it, it will be impossible to increase your crown authority.

Enacting this decision will result in a request to the Pope for a coronation ceremony to be held at Rome in honour of [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]. With [Root.GetTitledFirstName] sitting upon its throne in [Root.Capital.GetName], the Byzantine Empire is still flourishing and has only just begun to show signs of decadence. With the grace of God, [Root.GetSheHe] will be able to maintain its might and perhaps even restore the Roman Empire to its proper place in the civilized world once more.
Long live the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle]!
The Empire Cracks at the Seams

With [Root.GetTitledFirstName] currently sitting upon its throne in [Root.Capital.GetName], the Byzantine Empire is beginning to crack at the seams. Too many wars that should have been won have instead been lost through mismanagement and decadence, and there are those who say its time is nearing an end. With the grace of God, the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] will be able to reverse this trend and resture the might of the Roman Empire that once was.
The Empire is Falling

War after war against the infidels has been lost, and there are those who say it would take the grace of God Himself for the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] to shrug off the decadence of [Root.GetHerHis] court and restore what once was. The might of the Roman Empire of old seems but a distant dream.
The Empire is Shattered

With [Root.GetTitledFirstName] currently sitting upon its throne in [Root.Capital.GetName], the once-mighty Byzantine Empire is a shadow of its former grace. The court of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] has become decadent and corrupt, and there are many who question the possibility of the empire's mere survival, never mind dream of restoring the Roman Empire that once was.
